Backtest Overfitting: CSCV, PBO, PSR/DSR

Overview

  • Problem: With many candidate strategies, the best in‚Äësample often overstates true performance (selection bias, data snooping).
  • Guardrails:
    • Time‚Äëaware model selection (CSCV) ‚Üí quantify Probability of Backtest Overfitting (PBO) (Bailey et al. 2015)
    • Performance significance with non‚Äënormality: PSR; selection‚Äëbias deflation: DSR (Bailey and Prado 2014)

Key Definitions

  • CSCV: Combinatorially Symmetric Cross‚ÄëValidation (contiguous folds; swap in/out halves; select in‚Äësample champion; score out‚Äëof‚Äësample).
  • PBO: Fraction of CSCV splits where the in‚Äësample champion ranks poorly OOS (logit rank < 0).
  • PSR: Probabilistic Sharpe Ratio ‚Äî probability that true SR exceeds a benchmark under finite samples, skew, kurtosis.
  • DSR: Deflated Sharpe Ratio ‚Äî raises the benchmark SR to account for multiple, correlated trials.

Minimal Equations

Let (S) be observed Sharpe, (S_) the benchmark Sharpe. PSR (Lopez de Prado/Bailey):

[ = !(),, ]

where (_3) is skewness and (_4) kurtosis (normal=3), (n) sample size.

DSR increases (S_) to reflect the number of trials and their dependence (see Bailey and Prado (2014)).

Reporting Template (copy/paste)

  • Data: sample period, asset universe, costs/slippage assumptions, data vintage/release timing.
  • Trials: number of candidate strategies or hyper‚Äëparameter settings explored; correlation comment (e.g., similar families).
  • Selection: selection rule (e.g., in‚Äësample Sharpe), time‚Äëaware protocol (CSCV/walk‚Äëforward).
  • Robustness: CSCV PBO = X.XX (N splits); logit rank distribution shown.
  • Significance: PSR = X.XX vs benchmark SR*; DSR = X.XX (assumptions noted).
  • Decision: promote/park; plan for live validation.

Lightweight Code (repo utilities)

  • scripts/overfit_metrics.py:
    • cscv_pbo(returns, n_folds=10) ‚Üí PBO and diagnostics
    • probabilistic_sharpe_ratio(sr_hat, sr_star, n_obs, skew, kurtosis)
    • generate_noise_strategies(T, N, rho) for demos

See Lab 6B for full examples and figures. If mlfinlab is available, compare DSR implementations.

References

  • Bailey et al. (2015) ‚Äî Probability of Backtest Overfitting (PBO) and CSCV
  • Bailey and Prado (2014) ‚Äî Deflated Sharpe Ratio (DSR)
  • White (2000) ‚Äî Reality Check
  • Hansen (2005) ‚Äî SPA test

References

Bailey, David H., Jonathan M. Borwein, Marcos L√≥pez de Prado, and Qiji Jim Zhu. 2015. ‚ÄúThe Probability of Backtest Overfitting.‚Äù Journal of Computational Finance. https://doi.org/10.2139/ssrn.2326253.
Bailey, David H., and Marcos L√≥pez de Prado. 2014. ‚ÄúThe Deflated Sharpe Ratio: Correcting for Selection Bias, Backtest Overfitting and Non-Normality.‚Äù Journal of Portfolio Management 40 (5): 94‚Äì107. https://doi.org/10.2139/ssrn.2460551.
Hansen, Peter R. 2005. ‚ÄúA Test for Superior Predictive Ability.‚Äù Journal of Business & Economic Statistics 23 (4): 365‚Äì80. https://doi.org/10.1198/073500105000000063.
White, Halbert. 2000. ‚ÄúA Reality Check for Data Snooping.‚Äù Econometrica 68 (5): 1097‚Äì1126. https://doi.org/10.1111/1468-0262.00152.

---
title: "Backtest Overfitting: CSCV, PBO, PSR/DSR"
bibliography: reading.bib
---

## Overview

- Problem: With many candidate strategies, the best in‚Äësample often overstates true performance (selection bias, data snooping).
- Guardrails:
  - Time‚Äëaware model selection (CSCV) ‚Üí quantify Probability of Backtest Overfitting (PBO) [@bailey2015pbo]
  - Performance significance with non‚Äënormality: PSR; selection‚Äëbias deflation: DSR [@lopezdeprado2014dsr]

## Key Definitions

- CSCV: Combinatorially Symmetric Cross‚ÄëValidation (contiguous folds; swap in/out halves; select in‚Äësample champion; score out‚Äëof‚Äësample).
- PBO: Fraction of CSCV splits where the in‚Äësample champion ranks poorly OOS (logit rank < 0).
- PSR: Probabilistic Sharpe Ratio ‚Äî probability that true SR exceeds a benchmark under finite samples, skew, kurtosis.
- DSR: Deflated Sharpe Ratio ‚Äî raises the benchmark SR to account for multiple, correlated trials.

## Minimal Equations

Let \(\hat S\) be observed Sharpe, \(S_\star\) the benchmark Sharpe. PSR (Lopez de Prado/Bailey):

\[
\mathrm{PSR} = \Phi\!\left(\frac{(\hat S - S_\star)\,\sqrt{n-1}}{\sqrt{1 - \gamma_3\hat S + ((\gamma_4-1)/4)\,\hat S^2}}\right)\,,
\]

where \(\gamma_3\) is skewness and \(\gamma_4\) kurtosis (normal=3), \(n\) sample size.

DSR increases \(S_\star\) to reflect the number of trials and their dependence (see @lopezdeprado2014dsr).

## Reporting Template (copy/paste)

- Data: sample period, asset universe, costs/slippage assumptions, data vintage/release timing.
- Trials: number of candidate strategies or hyper‚Äëparameter settings explored; correlation comment (e.g., similar families).
- Selection: selection rule (e.g., in‚Äësample Sharpe), time‚Äëaware protocol (CSCV/walk‚Äëforward).
- Robustness: CSCV PBO = X.XX (N splits); logit rank distribution shown.
- Significance: PSR = X.XX vs benchmark SR*; DSR = X.XX (assumptions noted).
- Decision: promote/park; plan for live validation.

## Lightweight Code (repo utilities)

- `scripts/overfit_metrics.py`:
  - `cscv_pbo(returns, n_folds=10)` ‚Üí PBO and diagnostics
  - `probabilistic_sharpe_ratio(sr_hat, sr_star, n_obs, skew, kurtosis)`
  - `generate_noise_strategies(T, N, rho)` for demos

See Lab 6B for full examples and figures. If `mlfinlab` is available, compare DSR implementations.

## References

- @bailey2015pbo ‚Äî Probability of Backtest Overfitting (PBO) and CSCV  
- @lopezdeprado2014dsr ‚Äî Deflated Sharpe Ratio (DSR)  
- @white2000realitycheck ‚Äî Reality Check  
- @hansen2005spa ‚Äî SPA test
